timeline.body: Would prefer all fields be built-in Java types so they can be populated dynamically from Spring Boot config. It also keeps SDK classes from leaking outside the suppliers. For example, this field should be String.
timeline.bodyText: Would prefer all fields be built-in Java types so they can be populated dynamically from Spring Boot config. It also keeps SDK classes from leaking outside the suppliers. For example, this field should be String.
timeline.bodyHTML: Would prefer all fields be built-in Java types so they can be populated dynamically from Spring Boot config. It also keeps SDK classes from leaking outside the suppliers. For example, this field should be String.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: All fields have been refactored to be Java types.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.body: Null check here is redundant as setting null has no side effects. Can just add to chaining methods.
timeline.bodyText: Null check here is redundant as setting null has no side effects. Can just add to chaining methods.
timeline.bodyHTML: Null check here is redundant as setting null has no side effects. Can just add to chaining methods.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: The builder set method here is internally calling accountId.toProto(), which causes an NPE when it's null.  Seems like the sdk transactions do this to all account ids and all keys at least.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.body: Would prefer fields sorted alphabetically within their required/optional groupings. Would also prefer an extra newline between annotated fields as it's hard to read without.

timeline.body: Since we don't have an acronym HAS for accounts, etc. it might be better to name the package after the transaction prefix for consistency with the other network services. e.g. hcs -> consensus and hts -> token

timeline.body:
Can we make it so that the timestamp always starts the message and any optional message provided is added to it
```suggestion
                .setMessage(getMessage() + message != null ? "_" + message : '')
```
timeline.bodyText:
Can we make it so that the timestamp always starts the message and any optional message provided is added to it
  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            .setMessage(message != null ? message : getMessage())
          
          
            
                            .setMessage(getMessage() + message != null ? "_" + message : '')
timeline.bodyHTML:
Can we make it so that the timestamp always starts the message and any optional message provided is added to it

Suggested change
.setMessage(message != null ? message : getMessage())
.setMessage(getMessage() + message != null ? "_" + message : '')
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText:
I'm okay with adding a timestamp to the front, but if someone adds their own message do we want to continue generating random alphanumeric chars to fill it out?  I approached this as either give a complete message or give a message size to generate, not both.
I've pushed a variation on this where the getMessage() is changed to just append the timestamp to the custom message if applicable, let me know if you think differently.
replies.author: ijungmann

replies.bodyText: This is correct. Should be encodedTimestamp plus  on of the two, custom message or random message .
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.body:
This is missing the `setFreezeDefault` property.
Assuming default of false this will mean the freezeKey is set accounts onboarded to the token will have an Unfrozen status and can immediately start to transfer tokens.
Setting it to true would give the opposite effect.
timeline.bodyText:
This is missing the setFreezeDefault property.
Assuming default of false this will mean the freezeKey is set accounts onboarded to the token will have an Unfrozen status and can immediately start to transfer tokens.
Setting it to true would give the opposite effect.
timeline.bodyHTML:

@@ -0,0 +1,74 @@
+package com.hedera.datagenerator.sdk.supplier.hts;
+
+/*-
+ * ‌
+ * Hedera Mirror Node

+import java.time.Instant;
+import lombok.Builder;
+import lombok.Value;
+
+import com.hedera.datagenerator.sdk.supplier.TransactionSupplier;
+import com.hedera.hashgraph.sdk.account.AccountId;
+import com.hedera.hashgraph.sdk.crypto.ed25519.Ed25519PublicKey;
+import com.hedera.hashgraph.sdk.token.TokenCreateTransaction;
+
+@Builder
+@Value
+public class TokenCreateTransactionSupplier implements TransactionSupplier<TokenCreateTransaction> {
+    //Required
+    private final AccountId treasuryAccount;
+
+    //Optional
+    private final Ed25519PublicKey adminKey;
+    @Builder.Default
+    private final String symbol = "HMNT";
+    @Builder.Default
+    private final int initialSupply = 1000000000;
+    @Builder.Default
+    private boolean freezeDefault = false;
+    @Builder.Default
+    private int decimals = 10;
+    @Builder.Default
+    private final long maxTransactionFee = 1_000_000_000;
+
+    @Override
+    public TokenCreateTransaction get() {
+        TokenCreateTransaction tokenCreateTransaction = new TokenCreateTransaction()
+                .setSymbol(symbol)
+                .setName(symbol + "_name")
+                .setDecimals(decimals)
+                .setInitialSupply(initialSupply)
+                .setAutoRenewAccount(treasuryAccount)
+                .setTreasury(treasuryAccount)
+                .setMaxTransactionFee(maxTransactionFee)
+                .setTransactionMemo("Supplier Create token_" + Instant.now());
+
+        if (adminKey != null) {
+            tokenCreateTransaction
+                    .setAdminKey(adminKey)
+                    .setSupplyKey(adminKey)
+                    .setWipeKey(adminKey)
+                    .setFreezeKey(adminKey)

replies.bodyText: Good catch, I was flip-flopping on setting this field since in the vast majority of cases we would leave it to the default (false/not frozen), but I've added it back since more options probably isn't a bad thing.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.body:
Should we update this to be like the HCS submit message and use a timestamp here that will allow us to calculate latency on the perf subscriber side?
Pretty much set it to the same value returned by `ConsensusSubmitTransactionSupplier.getMessage()`
If there's an applicable class that can hold the function for sharing that would be good also.

I might do this on the acceptance side myself so suggesting it here also.

timeline.body:
nit: 
```suggestion
        return Utility.getEncodedTimestamp() + "_" + randomAlphanumeric;
```

Or call once and use is both returns
```java
String encodedTimestamp = Utility.getEncodedTimestamp();
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
nit:

Suggested change
return Base64.encodeBase64String(timeRefBytes) + randomAlphanumeric;
return Utility.getEncodedTimestamp() + "_" + randomAlphanumeric;

Or call once and use is both returns

String encodedTimestamp = Utility.getEncodedTimestamp();
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Went with the call once, use in both approach.

timeline.bodyHTML:
I realize we're repeating the encodedTimestamp + message + readable instant time.
We could move this into the new Utility class you added and make it easier

    public static String getTransactionMemo(String message) {
         return Utility.getEncodedTimestamp() + "_" + message + " at " + Instant.now();
     }
Suggested change
.setTransactionMemo(Utility.getEncodedTimestamp() + "_Mirror node wiped test token at " + Instant
.setTransactionMemo(Utility.getTransactionMemo("Mirror node wiped test token"))
timeline.author: Nana-EC

+import java.time.Instant;
+import lombok.Builder;
+import lombok.Value;
+
+import com.hedera.datagenerator.common.Utility;
+import com.hedera.datagenerator.sdk.supplier.TransactionSupplier;
+import com.hedera.hashgraph.sdk.account.AccountId;
+import com.hedera.hashgraph.sdk.token.TokenId;
+import com.hedera.hashgraph.sdk.token.TokenWipeTransaction;
+
+@Builder
+@Value
+public class TokenWipeTransactionSupplier implements TransactionSupplier<TokenWipeTransaction> {
+    private final String accountId;
+    private final String tokenId;
+
+    //Optional
+    @Builder.Default
+    private final long amount = 1;
+
+    @Builder.Default
+    private final long maxTransactionFee = 1_000_000_000;
+
+    @Override
+    public TokenWipeTransaction get() {
+        return new TokenWipeTransaction()
+                .setAccountId(AccountId.fromString(accountId))
+                .setAmount(amount)
+                .setMaxTransactionFee(maxTransactionFee)
+                .setTokenId(TokenId.fromString(tokenId))
+                .setTransactionMemo(Utility.getEncodedTimestamp() + "_Mirror node wiped test token at " + Instant

timeline.bodyHTML:
nit: It will always be 8 bytes, as it's a long, I should have changed this in the performance side also.
No biggie, can change in future PR or if there's a next commit.

Suggested change
int additionalBytes = messageSize <= timeRefBytes.length ? 0 : messageSize - timeRefBytes.length;
int additionalBytes = messageSize <= timeRefBytes.length ? 0 : messageSize - 8;

or

Suggested change
int additionalBytes = messageSize <= timeRefBytes.length ? 0 : messageSize - timeRefBytes.length;
int timeByteLength = 8;
int additionalBytes = messageSize <= timeRefBytes.length ? 0 : messageSize - timeByteLength;
timeline.author: Nana-EC
